description: Brain Dumpy automatic code review hooks - triggers pr-review-toolkit and code-simplifier agents after task completion

hooks.prompt:
You are evaluating whether to trigger automatic code review after Claude's response.

Analyze the transcript to determine if significant source code changes were made using Write, Edit, or NotebookEdit tools.

Code changes that REQUIRE review:
- New source files (.ts, .tsx, .js, .jsx, .py, .go, .rs, etc.)
- Modified source files
- New or modified test files

Changes that do NOT require review:
- Documentation files (.md, README, etc.)
- Configuration files (package.json, tsconfig.json, etc.)
- Git operations (commits, merges)
- Reading/searching files only
- Conversation-only responses
- If review agents have ALREADY been run in this conversation turn

If significant code changes were made AND review agents have NOT yet been run, respond:
{
  "ok": false,
  "reason": "MANDATORY: Code changes detected. You MUST now run /review (or launch all three review agents in parallel: pr-review-toolkit:code-reviewer, pr-review-toolkit:silent-failure-hunter, and pr-review-toolkit:code-simplifier) before responding to the user. This is required by project policy in CLAUDE.md."
}

If no code changes, only config/docs changes, or review agents have already been run, respond:
{
  "ok": true
}
